result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alec T Mueller

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:49 AM This case is being called for a hearing. Defendant Alec T Mueller in court.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for Alec T Mueller. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Atty Schiro advises that he has just received the offer and needs time to go over it with the defendant. Requesting a adjournment of about 45 days. Court will adjourn for further proceedings in about 45 days.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:46 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alec T Mueller in court.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for Alec T Mueller.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. Atty. Schiro provides an update; he is still negotiating the case with the ADA assigned.  Atty. Schiro requests another further proceedings in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
WCS case worker was notified by the clerk that at the 9/14/22 hearing Judge Reilly ordered that the defendant's next appointment with WCS be in person, not by telephone. (am)

2:02 PM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing. Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alec T Mueller in court.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for Alec T Mueller.   Court notes the matter is before the court to address WCS non-compliance as well as a request from the victim to be heard.  Court notes there was a WCS non-compliance letter filed on 8/24/22 but there was a compliance letter filed on 9/13/22.  Atty. Schiro presents statements with respect to the non-compliance; he is asking the court to take no action with respect to bail at this time given his client is now compliant.  State presents statements and will not be asking bail be modified at this time, noting if there are more positive tests in the near future they will seek an increase in bail.  Court inquires if the defendant has another appointment with WCS coming up soon.  Defendant advises he has a phone call appointment with WCS after court on 9/22/2022.  Court will order that the next appointment on 9/22/2022 after court now be an in person appointment.  Court admonishes the defendant with respect to the non-compliance and will take no position with respect to bail at this time; bail to remain as previously set.

Court will next address Victim A's request to be heard.  State notes the victim is present in court today, advises that the State objects to the request and presents statements.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny the Victim's request and order conditions of bail; including the no contact order, remain as set.  Court will maintain the previously scheduled hearing for 09/22/2022 at 1:30 p.m.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Motion and Order to Seal Victim's Request to be Heard signed by Judge Paul F Reilly September 8, 2022.
The original document was titled: Request to be heard _Victim A.
The original history event date is: 09-08-2022
State's Motion and Order to Seal Victim's Request to be Heard filed.
Victim A's Request to be Heard filed by the State.
Bail/bond hearing on September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 08-24-2022 received and filed.  **Reviewed by Judge Todd Martens, for Branch 7, 8/25/2022 - Court to set for sooner court date to address non-compliance.**
Hearing on September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:13 AM Defendant Alec T Mueller in court.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for Alec T Mueller.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Request to appear via zoom
**Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 08-22-2022. "Granted"
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Hearing on July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Court bumped to a WCS level 2.

02:09 PM Defendant Alec T Mueller in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers, as a friend of the court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
